content: Yes, this phenomenon is common and well-known. It's called the incubation period and it refers to the process of unconsciously working on a problem in your mind, even when you are not actively thinking about it. During this time, your brain is still processing information and making connections, which can lead to the breakthrough you experience when you wake up or fall asleep. This is a normal part of the problem-solving process and is often referred to as "sleeping on it."
